programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: The presenter examines how the car industry in Germany and Japan blossomed following the Second World War, becoming manufacturing giants that far outstripped the Allied nations that had defeated them. He test drives some of the vehicles Germany and Japan produced during the post-war period, as well as an assortment of other classic cars, including E-Types and Mustangs. He also reveals the sad tale of the Austin Allegro, a vehicle that had a devastating impact on the British car industry.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: The naturalist ventures into uncharted territory in pursuit of new discoveries. He takes on physical challenges, encounters extraordinary wildlife and meets remarkable people. In the first edition, Steve and a team of climbers and jungle survival experts head into the ancient landscape of South America's Guiana Shield. This vast wilderness of pristine forests and towering table-top mountains is one of the most inaccessible terrains on the planet.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: In the Jebel Akhdar mountain range of Oman, Steve leads an expedition into an unexplored desert canyon. With temperatures soaring, dehydration and heat stroke are a constant threat.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: The 2018 edition of the series in which teams of amateur racers test out their homemade, gravity-powered soapboxes on obstacle-littered courses in Johannesburg, South Africa. The entrants create vehicles without engines and race downhill in this popular offbeat event.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, James May and Richard Hammond travel to Africa, where they are challenged to buy a second-hand car costing less than 1,500 and in no way designed to go off-road, and drive across Botswana. Along the way they must negotiate salt pans, rivers and reserves full of animals while facing sweltering heat and suffocating dust.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Festive edition from 2008 in which Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on one of the most spectacular road trips they have ever attempted. Arriving in Vietnam, they are challenged to travel the entire length of the country in just eight days. First they must buy suitable transport for the journey, and despite having several million Dong in their pockets, this proves more difficult than they expected, especially in one of the most expensive car markets in the world.

programme.title: Top Gear: From A-Z
programme.desc: John Bishop narrates an alphabetical romp through the series' most memorable stunts and features as former hosts Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May pushed vehicles of all shapes and sizes to their limits. With 22 seasons of the show, there was no shortage of material to choose from as the likes of Tom Cruise and Cameron Diaz attempted to be the fastest Star in a Reasonably Priced Car, and the presenters risked life and limb in their assorted globe-trotting adventures.

programme.desc: Ben Fogle and Hugh Dennis undertake a perilous journey through the Peruvian Andes. Their route takes in 2,000ft drops, one-lane dirt roads, remote mountain trails and muddy, humid jungle terrain, as they search for the lost city of Constitucion, once destined to be the capital of Peru.

programme.desc: Steve and a team of rock climbers head to the desert of southern Oman to attempt the first ascent of a towering escarpment, hoping to discover the rare and elusive Arabian leopard.

programme.title: Top Gear: Winter Blunderland
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May present their best winter challenges.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May visit Africa on a mission to find the definitive source of the Nile, the world's longest river, which spans more than 4,000 miles. The trio believe they can do a better job than explorers who claim to have discovered the waterway's starting point by travelling further and faster than previous efforts - but the only tools at their disposal are determination, ingenuity and three ageing estate cars.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May head to Norway to find out how a selection of cars fare when taking part in Winter Olympic events. Their experiments include firing a rocket-powered Mini off a ski jump, tackling the biathlon with 4x4s, staging a game of motorised ice hockey and timing the Jaguar XK in a speed-skating race.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Presenters Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May are challenged to build a bridge over the River Kwai in Thailand. In order to do that, however, they have to drive across Burma, a country that has been largely closed to Westerners for more than 40 years, and must make the trip in three lorries, each bought sight unseen from the internet on a limited budget. What follows is an epic journey of beautiful scenery, regular adversity, ongoing malfunction and the constant bickering of the three men.

programme.title: Top Gear: Top Fails
programme.desc: A look back at all that Top Gear has tried and failed to accomplish, including spectacular fails, mixing shorter, one-off catastrophes with more developed failures.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the Brazil event, in which teams of amateur racers design and build their own gravity-powered soapbox vehicles and race them in an extreme downhill battle.

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Broadcasters Sue Perkins and Liza Tarbuck drive along the Ho Chi Minh Trail, a network of roads and paths in Southeast Asia that was littered with unexploded bombs following the Vietnam War. Their journey takes them through jungles and mountains to some of the least-explored corners of Laos and Vietnam, and proves to be a gruelling test of their bravery, motoring skills and senses of humour.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig has a Christmas knees-up in the pub with Alan Davies, Cariad Lloyd, Josh Widdicombe and Noel Fielding. Pub-themed questions are the order of the day, with a sprinkling of festive cheer along the way.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Chef Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall and comedians Rhod Gilbert, Rufus Hound and Miranda Hart are the guests on the comedy panel show. Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack guide the contestants as they try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by TV presenter Patrick Kielty, actor Bernard Cribbins, Dragons' Den judge Deborah Meaden and comedian Mark Watson on the comedy panel show. Rob Brydon chairs as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis host a festive special and are joined by an array of top names form the UK comedy circuit including Ed Byrne, James Acaster, Tom Allen, Rhys James, Zoe Lyons, Ed Gamble, Miles Jupp, Nish Kumar and Romesh Ranganathan for quizzes, challenges, out-takes and unseen material.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies sets his celebrity contestants challenges involving snowglobes, rubber ducks and wooden spoons. Alex Horne helps coax the contestants.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Stand-up and actress Jo Brand takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz, with broadcaster and journalist Grace Dent and comedian Kiri Pritchard-McLean joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig has a Christmas knees-up in the pub with Alan Davies, Cariad Lloyd, Josh Widdicombe and Noel Fielding. Pub-themed questions are the order of the day, with a sprinkling of festive cheer along the way.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: John Bishop, Chris Addison, Joanna Page and Patsy Palmer join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in the comedy panel show hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? - The Unseen Bits
programme.desc: A compilation of unseen material from this series of the comedy panel show hosted by Rob Brydon. Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by celebrity guests to dupe their opponents with plausible lies, featuring contestants including Ronnie Corbett, Bernard Cribbins, Richard E Grant, Jack Dee, Martin Clunes, Julian Clary and Sanjeev Bhaskar.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Host Dara O Briain and regular panellist Hugh Dennis serve up their unique festive take in a Christmas special filled with seasonal material, out-takes, best bits and hitherto unseen moments.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright thinks he has pulled a fast one by offloading a job lot of genuine Yorkshire clothes horses onto rival shopkeeper Albert Gupta - until his competitor makes a profit on them. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: The Spanish island of Villa Winter, which was suspected of being a port for German U-boats and part of a larger plan to invade the United States.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian attempts to zigzag his way 1,200 miles through Kenya and Tanzania, beginning this leg of his journey on a vintage steam locomotive designed in Glasgow. On a cattle farm established by an aristocrat a century ago, he dons a pair of overalls and joins workers as they bathe more than 2,000 animals to ward off parasites and biting flies. Later, in the vast Tsavo East National Park, he bottle-feeds orphaned elephant calves, before visiting a Maasai village - where he quickly regrets a faux pas during a meat feast.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Operation Grand Canyon with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Part one of two. The broadcaster joins a team of historians and geologists to recreate a pioneering 280-mile journey through the natural wonder that was led by explorer John Wesley Powell in 1869. Following in Powell's footsteps in the stunning yet challenging north Arizona landscape, Snow and the crew take on the area's rapids in antique wooden boats as they learn about the region's geological and Native American past.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian begins the next leg of his trip in Kasama, northern Zambia. His first stop is the town of Mpika, where he meets college students training to be locomotive drivers. Next, in the capital Lusaka, he reveals how the first railways were built to access the country's rich mineral wealth, and watches craftsmen cutting emeralds and rubies - before being let loose on a pair of bejewelled cufflinks. Griff then reaches the spectacular Victoria Falls on his way to Zimbabwe's second-largest city, Bulawayo.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and a team of specialist historians help Hektor Rous, the son of 'Aussie Earl' Keith Rous, piece together the mysterious history of the family's Tudor country home in Suffolk. In 2004, he moved from Melbourne, Australia, hoping to rebuild the estate's fortunes, and established events such as the Latitude Festival in its 3,500-acre grounds.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and his team head to an army training ground on Salisbury Plain to discover what lies beneath the Barrow Clump, a huge mound of earth built by Bronze Age people to bury their dead. More than 2,500 years later, the Anglo-Saxons re-used the location as a burial site, leaving behind some fascinating artefacts. The team is joined for the dig by a group of wounded soldiers whose members are being trained in archaeology as part of their rehabilitation.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: One of the largest Nazi bunkers ever constructed, outside the French town of Watten, a missile facility with storage for 108 missiles, a liquid oxygen factory and two launch pads.

programme.title: Viking Dead
programme.desc: How a well-preserved Viking ship discovered in 1904 continues to present archaeologists with new mysteries to unravel.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: The daring engineering that has overcome some of the greatest mountain ranges to create innovative railways, including a tunnel in the Swiss Alps and a zig-zag railway in Ecuador.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and his team head to an army training ground on Salisbury Plain to discover what lies beneath the Barrow Clump, a huge mound of earth built by Bronze Age people to bury their dead. More than 2,500 years later, the Anglo-Saxons re-used the location as a burial site, leaving behind some fascinating artefacts. The team is joined for the dig by a group of wounded soldiers whose members are being trained in archaeology as part of their rehabilitation.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the emperor penguin and the wood frog, both of which survive in conditions so cold they seem to defy the laws of nature. The emperor is the only penguin able to breed on Antarctic sea ice during winter, while the wood frog can survive up to 65 per cent of its body mass freezing during its hibernation.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines creatures that spin and weave, contemplating the history of silk production and its romantic origins in China.

programme.title: Life in the Undergrowth
programme.desc: An exploration of how invertebrates' production of silk 300 million years ago became their greatest invention. Stronger than a steel thread of the same diameter, the material is as pliable as elastic and employed by spiders for activities as diverse as courtship, catching prey and tending their young. David Attenborough reveals how some communal spiders create silken palaces rising 15m to 20m into the forest canopy.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The construction of London's Shard, revealing how it was influenced by the Milan Metro, concrete grain storage in Minnesota and a lifting mechanism in the Venice shipyards.

programme.title: Viking Dead
programme.desc: How a well-preserved Viking ship discovered in 1904 continues to present archaeologists with new mysteries to unravel.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: One of the largest Nazi bunkers ever constructed, outside the French town of Watten, a missile facility with storage for 108 missiles, a liquid oxygen factory and two launch pads.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: How some of our greatest railways have challenged engineering's finest minds in their efforts to conquer the planet's waterways, including a tunnel beneath the English Channel.

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World
programme.desc: How the steam train reached the height of its importance in Europe just as fresh innovations were being made in America, with groundbreaking trains like the Burlington Zephyr.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville changes his image with the help of some trendy clothes and a medallion made from a cocoa tin lid, while Arkwright decides to increase his profits through advertising.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville places an ad in a lonely hearts magazine and finally meets the girl of his dreams. After stretching the truth about being a young executive with a flash sports car, his romance ends before it even begins. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright thinks he has pulled a fast one by offloading a job lot of genuine Yorkshire clothes horses onto rival shopkeeper Albert Gupta - until his competitor makes a profit on them. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A strange-looking town with a supernatural atmosphere, a collection of imposing buildings in southern Australia, and the remains of curious-looking basins emerging from the waves.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Ffestiniog and Welsh Highland Railway are celebrating their annual Victorian Weekend, while in south Devon, silver service waiter Andy Leech runs the three-course Sunday lunch.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: One of the largest Nazi bunkers ever constructed, outside the French town of Watten, a missile facility with storage for 108 missiles, a liquid oxygen factory and two launch pads.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian begins the next leg of his trip in Kasama, northern Zambia. His first stop is the town of Mpika, where he meets college students training to be locomotive drivers. Next, in the capital Lusaka, he reveals how the first railways were built to access the country's rich mineral wealth, and watches craftsmen cutting emeralds and rubies - before being let loose on a pair of bejewelled cufflinks. Griff then reaches the spectacular Victoria Falls on his way to Zimbabwe's second-largest city, Bulawayo.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Operation Grand Canyon with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Part two of two. The historian and his team continue down the Colorado River in antique wooden boats as they re-create the pioneering 280-mile expedition through the Grand Canyon that was led by explorer John Wesley Powell in 1869. Along the way they carry out the same surveying tasks as the original party with period equipment, including taking photographs with a 19th-century 3D camera.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian makes five train journeys taking in the spectacular sights of Africa, travelling to unexpected places in deserts and forests, villages and cities, and finding out how the railways are used today. On the fourth leg of his journey across the continent, Griff travels across Namibia in the south-west, experiencing luxury camping, encountering cheetahs, and visiting 1,000-foot sand dunes.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team head to the Lake District to look for copper, a forgotten piece of the nation's industrial heritage. There are nearly two dozen old mines across the mountains, some thought to have been established 400 years ago when the valleys would have been studded with workshops, scaffolding and water-powered machines, home to a brave band of Tudor miners. The team battles the rain, wind and dangerously unstable trackways, but the combination of sheer effort and hi-tech kit enables the experts to access the heart of an old mine.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: The team heads to the small county of Rutland to visit Oakham Castle, the most well-preserved 12th-century building in Britain. It was once home to the Norman knight Walkelin de Ferrers, who fought alongside Richard the Lionheart in the Crusades, and before that the residence of several Saxon kings and queens. Tony and the crew investigate de Ferrers' long-lost private quarters, but it takes three days of twists and turns to determine what the site looked like 900 years ago. To mark the visit, they also cast a giant Time Team horseshoe to add to the collection that has decorated the castle hall for half a millennium.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: Dag Bromberg: A City in the Forest
programme.desc: As the Red Army approached a forest in Poland toward the end of the war, they stumbled upon a massive complex containing more than a thousand structures across 25sqkm.

programme.title: Viking Dead
programme.sub-title: The Lost Viking Fleet of Roskilde
programme.desc: The remains of a fleet of Viking boats, and the modern historians attempting to recreate them.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: How some of our greatest railways have challenged engineering's finest minds in their efforts to conquer the planet's waterways, including a tunnel beneath the English Channel.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough reveals why male seahorses give birth, and looks at how hyena packs are dominated by the female members.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores nature's evolutionary anomalies and examines creatures whose stretched features have given them an edge in the natural world.

programme.title: Life in the Undergrowth
programme.desc: David Attenborough turns his attention to the network of partnerships that invertebrates have developed with one another and with plants. He reveals how the fairy wasp, the world's smallest insect, flies underwater to inject its eggs into those of the water beetle. Footage also shows how the caterpillar of the blue butterfly smuggles its way into an ants' nest by mimicking the smell of their young.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the US navy's most advanced nuclear submarine - which can remain underwater for months at a time - examining the previous vessels that influenced it.

programme.title: Viking Dead
programme.sub-title: The Lost Viking Fleet of Roskilde
programme.desc: The remains of a fleet of Viking boats, and the modern historians attempting to recreate them.

programme.desc: As the Red Army approached a forest in Poland toward the end of the war, they stumbled upon a massive complex containing more than a thousand structures across 25sqkm.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: A look at the planet's most incredible metropolitan railways, and how they help people solve distinctly urban problems. Including a project to upgrade New York's transit system.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: On the Welsh Highland Railway, a newly built Pullman carriage is on its way to Caernarfon Station and a Saddle Tank Loco is being completely restored on the East Lancashire Railway.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A little-known dark past explains the vast monolithic structures that dominate the small British island of Guernsey.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: A look at some of Switzerland's 300,000 subterranean bunkers, built across history. Plus, the extraordinary creation of a Liverpool entrepreneur that's shrouded in mystery, and a network of man-made tunnels used by adventurous subterranean thrill-seekers deep beneath Slovenia's landscape.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Deadliest Crash: Disaster at Le Mans
programme.desc: Documentary examining what caused Pierre Levegh's Mercedes to crash into the crowd during the 1955 Le Mans 24-hour race, killing more than 80 people - an accident that remains the worst in the history of motor racing. Among the theories discussed are the use of untested technologies by the car's manufacturers, the addition of a lethal fuel additive and allegations of reckless driving by future Formula One world champion Mike Hawthorn, who won the race with Jaguar team partner Ivor Bueb. Narrated by Jack Deam.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: On the final leg of his journey, the comedian crosses 1,000 miles of South Africa, reaching the most southerly passenger railway station on the continent. Heading to Johannesburg, he reveals how the city has benefited from the scale of gold-mining in the area. Later on, he takes to the skies in a light aircraft for a bird's-eye view of one of South Africa's largest ostrich farms, and catches one of the world's most luxurious trains for a seven-hour ride to Cape Town, before reaching the coastal settlement of Simon's Town.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: The experts head to a field in south Oxfordshire where significant findings were made by an inquisitive PhD student half a century ago, including a mosaic and the stone walls of a former Roman building. Tony Robinson and the crew examine aerial pictures showing clear building lines in the ground, and speak to the current landowner, a farmer who continues to uncover bricks and tiles. They try to evaluate the building's purpose and how the Thames may have shifted the remains over the course of two millennia.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team search for the remains of a Norman castle in Dundrum, Co Down, one of Northern Ireland's most picturesque counties, exploring a territory established by renegade knight John de Courcy in the 12th century against the orders of King John. The castle was later rebuilt, and much of its replacement is still standing, but the experts are convinced that some of what remains dates from de Courcy's time - and discover that it may go back even further.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: A secret weapons program in the heart of Austria that could have ended badly for the Allies - and may have indicated nuclear plans being concocted by Hitler.

programme.title: Viking Dead
programme.desc: A look at the discovery of various sites where Vikings had buried treasure, examining why they did it and where the loot came from originally.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: A look at the planet's most incredible metropolitan railways, and how they help people solve distinctly urban problems. Including a project to upgrade New York's transit system.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines how fleas are able to jump great distances for their size and attempts to discover how fast a cheetah can run.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores animals that have developed tool-making skills to help them survive, including orangutans and crows.

programme.title: Life in the Undergrowth
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores how insects compensate for their small size by banding together in vast numbers. He reveals that the operations of many of these societies are so finely tuned they appear to work as a single entity. Footage shows how African termite mounds act as huge ventilation systems of such sophistication that humans are only now beginning to unravel the mechanics of the structure.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The extension of the Panama Canal to accommodate the world's largest ships, which drew inspiration from the work of 17th-century engineer Hugues Cosnier.

programme.title: Viking Dead
programme.desc: A look at the discovery of various sites where Vikings had buried treasure, examining why they did it and where the loot came from originally.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: A secret weapons program in the heart of Austria that could have ended badly for the Allies - and may have indicated nuclear plans being concocted by Hitler.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: The engineering breakthroughs that allow trains to go faster than ever thought possible, including technology that allows trains to navigate the winding mountains of Spain at speed.

programme.title: Churchill's Secret Son
programme.desc: Documentary telling the story of Tipperary-born businessman and Conservative cabinet minister Brendan Bracken, who became Winston Churchill's right-hand man during the Second World War by opposing efforts to appease Adolf Hitler. The film considers the possibility of a biological connection between the two men.

programme.title: The Good Nazi
programme.desc: The story of Major Karl Plagge, a high-ranking Nazi officer who risked his own life to save hundreds of people, in a story reminiscent of Schindler's List.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: An examination of how Leon Degrelle and an array of Finns, Estonians and fellow Belgians joined German volunteer brigades to hold off the Red Army on the Eastern front during the Second World War and enabled 56,000 men to escape.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: A profile of Robert Cecil, a formidable political operator who devised and established an extraordinary web of spies and informers designed to ensure King James I's security.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Acclaimed chronicle of the Second World War, beginning with an account of Hitler's ascent to power at a time when the Germans were stricken by humiliating military defeat, runaway inflation and economic depression. The Nazi leader's promises of regained national pride and prosperity struck a chord with millions of ordinary citizens, and he was elected on a tidal wave of popular support. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The months following prime minister Neville Chamberlain's declaration of war against Germany, in which the only casualties on the home front were those who had to endure the blackouts. Elsewhere in Europe, the Nazi war machine cut a swathe of destruction. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How, in 1940, the French Army suffered a heavy defeat after underestimating the Nazis' strength while relying on First World War strategies and equipment to defend its frontiers. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough narrates the documentary exploring Earth's natural history and the factors that have affected it. The first edition examines how the sun affects life on Earth through the seasons, following a polar bear preparing its cubs for a long journey to avoid becoming stranded on floating glaciers. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: A tour of the mightiest rivers in the world, from the deep waters of Siberia's Lake Baikal, home to the world's only freshwater seal, to the wetlands downstream of Earth's tallest waterfall patrolled by frenzied piranhas. There is also footage of the lightning-quick ambush of wildebeest by crocodiles in Africa and macaque monkeys swimming underwater to catch crabs in Indonesia. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough looks at the world's caves, including the Lechuguilla Cave in America, which contains chambers filled with 6m-long crystals. He observes creatures in Texas and Thailand that never see daylight, and inside Deer Cave in Borneo he finds five million bats whose droppings support an entire ecosystem.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The nature series looks at animals that live on some of the world's highest mountains. Cameras show gelada baboons screaming to frighten off predators in Ethiopia, demoiselle cranes struggling to migrate over the Himalayas, snow leopards hunting on the peaks of Pakistan and a wild giant panda nursing a baby in a hillside cave. Presented by David Attenborough.

Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Recalling a decade in British music, with archive performances from the early stages of the 'swingin' era, featuring music by by rock, pop and R'n'B artists including the Springfields, the Shadows, the Beatles and the Rolling Stones.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: More pop, rock and rhythm and blues from the archives, featuring appearances by the Rolling Stones, the Dave Clark Five, the Seekers and the Byrds from 1964 and '65.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: A selection of archive footage from the arrival of the so-called beat boom in 1964, which catered to the art-school craze for rhythm and blues. Featuring performances by Tom Jones, the Kinks, Manfred Mann, the Rolling Stones, John Lee Hooker and the Pretty Things.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Folk performances by artists including Pete Seeger, Tim Buckley, Joan Baez, Bob Dylan and Leonard Cohen.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Music from the Top of the Pops archives, featuring performances by acts including the Foundations, Procol Harum, the Bee Gees, the Rolling Stones, and Dave Dee, Dozy, Beaky, Mick and Tich.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Music from the flower power era, featuring bands including Herman's Hermits, the Crazy World of Arthur Brown, the Alan Price Set, Manfred Mann and the Rolling Stones.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Archive clips featuring solo artists, including music by performers as diverse as Sandie Shaw, Dusty Springfield, Long John Baldry and Tom Jones.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Celebration of the decade's psychedelic music, featuring counter-culture classics by the Who, Pink Floyd, Joe Cocker, the Nice and the Jimi Hendrix Experience.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: On the Welsh Highland Railway, a newly built Pullman carriage is on its way to Caernarfon Station and a Saddle Tank Loco is being completely restored on the East Lancashire Railway.

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World
programme.desc: How the steam train reached the height of its importance in Europe just as fresh innovations were being made in America, with groundbreaking trains like the Burlington Zephyr.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: On the final leg of his journey, the comedian crosses 1,000 miles of South Africa, reaching the most southerly passenger railway station on the continent. Heading to Johannesburg, he reveals how the city has benefited from the scale of gold-mining in the area. Later on, he takes to the skies in a light aircraft for a bird's-eye view of one of South Africa's largest ostrich farms, and catches one of the world's most luxurious trains for a seven-hour ride to Cape Town, before reaching the coastal settlement of Simon's Town.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: A profile of Robert Cecil, a formidable political operator who devised and established an extraordinary web of spies and informers designed to ensure King James I's security.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Shakespeare - The Legacy with John Nettles
programme.desc: The actor examines the life of the Bard, investigating key moments and trying to discover what may have happened in a seven-year gap where he disappears from historical records.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: Profile of Cardinal Richelieu, who as Louis XIII's diabolical chief minister, was feared and hated thanks to his complex spy network.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The drop in morale of Churchill's forces following the fall of France to Nazi forces during the Second World War, and how the Dunkirk evacuation and the Battle of Britain helped to restore British confidence. Plus, America's reasons for initially refusing to enter the conflict.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: An account of Hitler's decision to invade the Soviet Union, which produced an initial series of dazzling victories until the harsh winter of 1941 took hold, with fatal consequences for the ill-equipped German army. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates this documentary chronicling events leading up to the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbour on December 7, 1941, and the subsequent collapse of unprepared British forces before the advancing enemy in Singapore. Includes interviews with veterans from both sides.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough focuses on animals living in deserts. Cameras explore the dry Atacama of Chile, where guanacos survive by licking dew off cacti, and capture the rare sight of wild camels eating snow to stay hydrated on Mongolia's Gobi plains. In the rocky Namibian desert, elephants desperately search for food and lions wander the wilderness hunting oryx.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Camera crews follow the activities of wildlife in the Arctic and Antarctic, including an emperor penguin colony's nine-month migration across sea ice to its breeding ground. The team also takes aerial and underwater shots to capture humpback whales feeding and tracks a male polar bear as it swims 100km to find new ice from which to hunt seals.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The wildlife on the great plains of Africa, Asia, North America and the Arctic, which cover a quarter of the land on Earth. The distinctive Tibetan fox is captured on film for the first time, while a herd of caribou migrates 2,000 miles across the tundra in search of grass. Night vision equipment tracks a pride of 30 lions hunting elephants in the tropical African savannah near one of the region's few remaining waterholes. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: An insight into woodlands around the world, from the stunted conifers cloaked in snow and ice in the Arctic forests, to the broadleaf woods in North America and Europe. Also featured are the 100m-high giant redwoods of California, as well as Madagascar's unusual upside-down trees, which store water in their swollen trunks and harbour strange wildlife. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: The First Silent Night
programme.desc: Simon Callow discovers the origin of the Christmas carol and the story of the two Austrians who wrote it.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A little-known dark past explains the vast monolithic structures that dominate the small British island of Guernsey.

programme.title: WW2 Price of Empire
programme.desc: History of the conflict, examining its lasting impact on the political powers that were involved, beginning with a look at 1939 and how different countries were drawn into the war.

programme.title: WW2 Price of Empire
programme.desc: Archive footage and personal testimony exploring the early advances made by Germany, Italy and the USSR.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Factors influencing America's decision to support Britain during the Second World War, and how Hitler's declaration of war on the US convinced Congress to take more decisive action. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The battle for North Africa, which involved three years of fighting between Rommel's Afrika Korps and Montgomery's Desert Rats and culminated in the Allied victory at El Alamein. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How the myth of German invincibility was finally debunked by their defeat at the Battle of Stalingrad. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough observes some of the varied species to be found in tropical rainforests, from the amusing courtship rituals of the birds of paradise and a chimpanzee group defending its territory to a flying-frog mating orgy and the sinister parasitic fungi cordyceps, which eat their victims alive.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Following the epic journey of a humpback whale and its calf as they travel from a tropical paradise to the species' great feeding ground in the icy polar seas. David Attenborough also observes footage of colonies of seabirds in the Arabian desert and surfing dolphins in Australia that swim onto the beach to catch their fish.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: An exploration of the survival techniques used by creatures inhabiting the deep oceans of the world, where adaptation is paramount for those dwelling on the surface as well as below. Pods of dolphins are filmed charging in search of prey, surprising methods for conserving energy are revealed as deep-sea octopuses 'fly' with wings, and vampire squid use bioluminescence to create a colourful display.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of wildlife that inhabit remote islands, revealing the advantages and disadvantages of the creatures' habitat. Three-toed sloths in the Caribbean and nesting albatross enjoy a peaceful existence untroubled by predators, but other animals are not so fortunate. Marine iguanas in the Galapagos Islands are preyed on by racer snakes from birth, while penguins on the Antarctic island of Zavodovski risk being battered against the rocks by fierce waves.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: Incredible feats of human endeavour, revealing what people have built, where they've built it, how and why. The first edition explores deep inside the rock on Gibraltar where there's over 55km complex of tunnels, under London, where 21st-century engineering innovation is paving the way for the ultimate super sewer and continues the legacy of Victorian pioneers and reveals the extraordinary subterranean space of one of Europe's largest and most breath-taking natural cave systems - The Postojna Cave in Slovenia.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A settlement in Argentina destroyed by floods, a town in the US that has been erased, and a Soviet dream-town that turned into a nuclear nightmare.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of a North Yorkshire-based, family-run historic car auction business, which uncovers some remarkably rare vehicles in the picturesque village of Thornton-le-Dale.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Documentary following the exploits of a family-run crew of heavy-haulage specialists as they transport the heaviest, longest and most precious locomotives around the world. Terry and Jason have been called in to move legendary steam locomotive Britannia. The 68-year-old vehicle has undergone a major restoration in Crewe and is scheduled to start running at the Severn Valley Railway.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of three preserved steam railway lines - the South Devon Railway heritage line, the Ffestiniog and Welsh Highlands Railway and the Great Central Railway. Sports scientist Megan Smith has a dream of becoming a steam locomotive fireman on the Ffestiniog & Welsh Highland Railway, and she fires-up NG143 and sets off along the 25 miles from Caernarfon to Porthmadog.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The untold secret story of war production that shaped the Second World War, beginning with how the German aviation industry came to dominate the skies of Europe.

programme.title: World's Greatest Palaces
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of Hampton Court Palace, which started out life as a Tudor palace in 1515 and is famous for being the home of King Henry VIII.

programme.title: World's Greatest Palaces
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of Schnbrunn Palace in Austria, which is located in a 500-acre park and includes an orangery, palm house and one of Europe's oldest zoos.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: WW2 Price of Empire
programme.desc: The German army's Blitzkrieg tactics, which led to the swift conquest of Holland, Belgium and France.

programme.title: WW2 Price of Empire
programme.desc: A focus on the Battle of Britain and the Blitz and the Italian troops entering North Africa.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How German U-boats were used to disrupt the flow of goods from America across the Atlantic Ocean in an attempt to starve Britain into submission.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Account of Operation Barbarossa, Germany's plan to invade the Soviet Union in 1941, revealing the massive human and financial cost endured by the Soviet people, who fought a bloody and lonely war with little support from the Allies. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: British bombers are unable to hit their targets precisely and attack German cities under cover of darkness, while the Blitz in Britain brings public demand for revenge strikes, and Arthur Harris takes charge of Bomber Command.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Rare footage of the elusive animals that live in the unforgiving environment of the world's mountain ranges. A female snow leopard with a cub ends up caught between two rival males, grizzly bears rub themselves up against trees in an attempt to shed their winter fur, and golden eagles hunt over snow-capped peaks.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of plants and animals that live in jungles, one of the hardest environments to thrive in, including strange fungi and creatures that glow in the dark which have never been captured on film before. The programme also includes recordings of caimans and the jaguars that prey on them, freshwater dolphins that swim through flooded forests, undergrowth-dwelling frogs that have to defend themselves against wasps, and the Indri, the world's largest living lemur, which inhabits the forests of Madagascar.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of animals that live in the desert, including a pride of desert lions that risks hunting a giraffe several times their size. The film also features an immense swarm of locusts, sand grouse flying for 120 miles to gather water for their offspring, and an unprecedented recording of a tiny bat defending itself against one of the world's deadliest scorpions.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Wildlife that inhabit the world's grasslands, areas that are struck by some of the most dramatic seasonal changes seen in the world. The programme features footage of Brazil's giant anteaters and Asian saiga antelope, as well as lions engaging in ferocious battles with buffalo in the flooded Okavango, bee-eaters taking advantage of elephants to help them catch insects, and caribou embarking on migrations across the freezing northern tundra, stalked every step of the way by predatory Arctic wolves.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: A look at Sweden's passion for subterranean spaces and how this nation has taken extraordinary precautions to protect itself - by excavating an astounding 65,000 nuclear bunkers. In south-west England, deep in the Mendip Hills of Somerset, lies one of the most spectacular landscapes in the UK, but beneath this breath-taking landscape sits secret caverns and magical rock formations carved out by nature. Plus, how in Romania, nside a 1.2km-thick layer of salt, sits a world underground first.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A seemingly endless concrete line stretching through the French countryside, which sits as a monument to a discarded engineering advancement.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A rare 1980s Sierra Cosworth draws in a crowd of admiring Ford fans, while a restorer delights buyers with his immaculate 1966 Sunbeam Rapier and Sarah takes a shine to a caravan.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Expert hauliers Eric Harrison and Chris Case move an iconic Deltic diesel, better known as The Royal Highland Fusilier, halfway across the country to the Telford Steam Fair.

programme.desc: At the Ffestiniog and Welsh Highlands Railway, manager Stephen Greig is trying to ensure that all goes to plan ahead of the opening of the new station at Caernarfon.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The story behind the Krupp company, who were responsible for the manufacture of two of Germany's most feared war products - the Panzer Tank and the U-boat.

programme.title: World's Greatest Palaces
programme.desc: The Royal Palace of Caserta near Naples, Italy, which was created by Luigi Vanvitelli and houses a silk factory that dates back to the 18th century and still functions to this day.

programme.title: World's Greatest Palaces
programme.desc: Kensington Palace in London, which began life as an early 17th-century Jacobean mansion before becoming a palace fit for the monarchy, and was the brainchild of Christopher Wren.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Still working undercover, Kerry gets in way over her head after witnessing the death of a Radford escort girl and being ordered to give one of the others a beating, and Rob begins to fear the worst when she goes for days without reporting back. As Neil's relationship with Andrea blossoms, he lets slip some of his most closely guarded secrets about his colleagues - not least big cheese Adam Okaro - which soon end up on the front pages of the newspapers. Gina is distraught to discover Jonathan has requested a transfer to another station.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Dale realises that Kerry has embarked on a foolhardy undercover mission to investigate the Radford clan and tracks her down, begging her to pull out before it's too late - but she turns a deaf ear to his pleas, putting both their lives in peril. Newlyweds Jim and June return to Sun Hill to be met by a mob of journalists baying for Adam's blood, while Reg begins to have second thoughts about pursuing a relationship with Marilyn.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Ian is threatening to alienate Hattie by playing a game of cat and mouse with his staff.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pat and Frank offer Lorraine a place to stay. Frank wants to know where they met, and asks Pat for some straight answers.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Ash and Laura prepare to tie the knot, but the groom-to-be's father is strongly against the union since he has yet to meet Laura and thinks they are getting married too quickly. While working his last shift, Daniel manages to save a little girl's life by removing a pen top lodged in her throat. Baz acquires an ultrascan image of her baby and proudly shows it to Charlie.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A dawn raid by bailiffs leaves the antiques dealer staring ruin in the face, and with nothing left to look forward to, he decides to turn his back on society. With Ian McShane and guest star Alexei Sayle.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Crooks realise Jim's investigations are bringing him dangerously close to nailing them - so they set out to undermine his credibility by driving him back to the bottle. John Nettles plays the Jersey-based detective.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Christmas edition of the Only Fools and Horses spin-off from 2007. Former Cheers actor George Wendt makes a guest appearance as a former GI who was billeted in the village during the 1970s, and has returned to find out whether he fathered any children during his stay. It does not take Marlene long to see what made him such a hit with the ladies, but Boycie proves harder to win over - until he discovers his unwanted guest is extremely wealthy. Sue Holderness and John Challis star.

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Margo returns her entire Christmas order because the tree is too short - and she and Jerry are left with no means to celebrate after the department store fails to redeliver in time. Tom and Barbara come to the rescue, inviting them round for a Christmas of homemade paper hats and improvised party games. Seasonal special from 1977, starring Richard Briers, Penelope Keith, Paul Eddington and Felicity Kendal.

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Margo insists that Jerry keep fit so he will be well enough to enjoy his retirement when it comes. Tom realises he and Barbara have no money set aside for their old age and presents a bank manager with an unusual proposition. George Cole guest stars in the final episode of the sitcom, made for the 1978 Royal Command Performance.

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Lynley and Havers investigate when young lawyer Emily Proctor is found axed to death in Hyde Park. They are led to the chambers of a human rights barrister who was having an affair with her, and it isn't long before the victim's seedy double life involving Internet porn and dark family secrets emerges. Detective drama, starring Nathaniel Parker, Sharon Small and Samuel West.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The detectives are asked to carry out a preliminary investigation into a corrupt senior officer who may have suppressed evidence when a notorious crime boss was put away for murdering a prominent doctor. However, Sasha feels torn because she is almost certain that eight years earlier the convict in question also killed her CID partner. Meanwhile, Steve gets a shock when his estranged son turns up at work to see him. Tamzin Outhwaite and Denis Lawson star.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Double bill. A suspected paedophile is found dead in a playground, so inexperienced detective Rory Drennan calls in Nikki and Jack to attend. It's not long before the team links his murder to the case of a missing young girl, so the child-protection officers are also brought in - though it soon becomes apparent the youngster's social worker blames herself for the disappearance. Starring Emilia Fox, David Caves and Richard Lintern, with Claudie Blakley, Lorraine Burroughs and John Dagliesh.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Hugh is facing his biggest crisis yet when his love life, career and family are all in desperate need of a help. Also, Charlie plays dirty to win back Matt.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Hugh and the hospital staff use blackmail to get rid of their incompetent boss Norah, while Penny faces family and romantic dilemmas that will change her future.

Festive special from 1991, starring Patricia Routledge, Clive Swift and Geoffrey Hughes.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances

Suburban comedy, guest starring Una Stubbs alongside starring Patricia Routledge, Clive Swift and Geoffrey Hughes.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances

Two-part story, starring Emilia Fox, David Caves and Richard Lintern, with Lauren O'Neil, Pippa Haywood and Shaun Dingwall.

But when he proves to have a solid alibi, the investigation shifts closer to home. Starring Emilia Fox and David Caves, with James Alexandrou and Jason Watkins.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Girl
programme.desc: Feature-length period drama, starring Siobhan Flynn. A dying woman takes her daughter to the home of her former lover, a wealthy mine agent, who takes the child in. But the man's wife is less than happy about the arrangement and determines to keep the girl apart from her own offspring. With Jonathan Cake, Mark Benton and Susan Jameson.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Boxing Day sees heavy snowfall covering the country and the adverse weather causes major disruption across Poplar as roads become blocked and pipes freeze meaning families have to queue outside for water from standpipes. Sister Julienne must inform a family about the death of their loved one and uncovers an uncomfortable truth, while Valerie helps an unmarried couple living in a caravan prepare for their baby, but unforeseen complications knock her confidence in her ability as a midwife. Guest starring Anita Dobson.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives move into their new premises following the explosion that wrecked the old Nonnatus House, and are joined by fresh arrival Sister Winifred - a kindly-but-naive young woman. Jenny becomes concerned about new mother Merle's mental state and the welfare of her baby, who isn't feeding properly. Dr Turner believes it could be something more serious - although the mystery is eventually solved by the last person anyone would have expected. Chummy is struggling to adjust to her new role as a housewife and mother, and organises an open day at the community centre. Jessica Raine, Stephen McGann and Miranda Hart star.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Trixie's feathers are ruffled when Jenny is promoted, but the new Acting Sister has more to worry about after a mother-to-be reveals the baby she is carrying was not fathered by her husband - and to complicate matters, the real father is black. Cynthia is inspired by a lecture on natural childbirth, convinced it will help an overly anxious patient, while Alec and his friends try to persuade Jenny to join them on a CND march. Jessica Raine, Helen George and Bryony Hannah star in the 1950s-set nursing drama.

programme.title: The Lady Vanishes
programme.desc: It is 1931 and socialite Iris Carr (Tuppence Middleton) is travelling back from a holiday in the Balkans, but faints on the platform of the railway station in the scorching heat. She is comforted by fellow passenger Miss Froy (Selina Cadell), but when Iris falls asleep she awakes to find the woman has disappeared and everyone else on board denies ever having seen her. With only handsome traveller Max Hare (Tom Hughes) for support, Iris maintains that Miss Froy has somehow been abducted - even though it increasingly appears to be a delusion on her part. Mystery, also starring Keeley Hawes, Gemma Jones, Stephanie Cole and Julian Rhind-Tutt. Adapted from Ethel Lina White's novel, The Wheel Spins.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest finds himself embroiled with MI5, which puts Lady Felicia in a compromising position - will she betray her friend to protect secrets from her own past? Drama, starring Mark Williams and Nancy Carroll.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Millionaire environmentalist and scientist Dan Hagen is shot on his boat while out at sea, and all the evidence points toward a robbery gone wrong, but DI Goodman suspects foul play by a crew member. The team soon realises the group are not as close-knit as they initially seem, and with everyone hiding a secret, the pressure is on to get to the bottom of how and why Dan was killed. The case gives the British detective a sudden desire to become a sailor, while Florence surprises the team with her action hero credentials. Caribbean crime drama, starring Kris Marshall and Josphine Jobert.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: The apparent suicide of a DJ leads Nikki to question her judgement in a strikingly similar case from her past and she brings the potential mistake to the attention of her colleagues, but the news threatens to have repercussions for the family of the deceased, the police and the Lyell Centre. The fresh evidence leads to the conclusion that a copycat killer is at large and Nikki finds evidence that an intruder has been entering her home. Feature-length episode of the drama, starring Emilia Fox.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Sequel to The White Queen, set in the Middle Ages and picking up as the tumultuous War of the Roses comes to an end, a new generation ascends to the throne in a tale of power, political clashes, family, love and betrayal. As the victor of the Battle of Bosworth, Henry Tudor, is set to ascend the throne and Elizabeth of York and her family, supporters of the former King, find themselves in grave danger. Lizzie must fulfil her promise to marry King Henry VII and bring peace to the nation. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: The threatened closure of Goddard's following the outbreak of a virus among the children of Skelthwaite prompts Vic to speculate on the real source of the contamination. Meanwhile, Simon and Anna have relationship problems. Rural drama, starring Lesley Dunlop and Leslie Ash.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Intrigue and frustration are the order of the day as Anna and Karen come to terms with the possibility that a patient may be suffering domestic abuse. Jess finally gets what's coming to her, while Dick, Cheryl and Oscar struggle to settle into family life. Drama, starring Lesley Dunlop, Leslie Ash and Phil Middlemiss.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: The Skelthwaite Scorpions hop across the Channel for a match with their twin-town team. The competition doesn't take up all their time, however, as Vic finds his uncle's war grave. Simon, meanwhile, has a rendezvous with a local businesswoman and Chris falls for a hiker.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Julienne receives an SOS from Holloway Prison, whose usual maternity workers have been struck down by illness, and when she and Trixie step in to help, the nun puts her reputation on the line to prevent a heavily pregnant convict having her unborn baby taken away by social services. Shelagh faces heartache when a routine pregnancy check reveals something far more serious, Alec has a confession for Jenny, and Fred takes the gang to the theatre to celebrate Chummy's birthday - only for the trip to end in disaster. Lacey Turner, best known as EastEnders' Stacey Branning, guest stars.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Jenny has an eventful few days, starting with a patient who as well as having herself to worry about, is also struggling to cope with her mother, an agoraphobic who hasn't been outside for at least 12 years. On top of that, Alec asks the midwife to accompany him to Brighton for the weekend, leaving her wondering if his intentions are strictly honourable. However, things soon take a tragic turn. Meanwhile, Shelagh joins the local choir to take her mind off her problems. Jessica Raine, Leo Staar and Laura Main star.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives are busy preparing for Sister Evangelina's surprise jubilee celebrations, marking 50 years since she took her vows, but a face from the past threatens to ruin the party for the guest of honour. It's back to business when a young woman with Down's syndrome is brought in feeling unwell. To everyone's surprise, they discover she is six months pregnant, causing some of them to think the worst, and the staff are joined by new nurse Patsy, whose sense of humour and no-nonsense attitude make her an instant hit.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Trixie is chuffed when local curate Tom invites her to join him for a day of cricket, sending her to work with a spring in her step. Is love on the cards for the young midwife? Shelagh's infertility has made her think long and hard about what she wants in life, so she approaches her husband with an idea, while Patsy upsets a young mother in the clinic and is moved to the district rota, where she works tirelessly to diagnose a docker's unusual symptoms.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.sub-title: Are You Being Served? Special Christmas 1979
programme.desc: The staff of Grace Brothers stage a life-size Punch and Judy show to entertain a group of their colleagues' children. Christmas special of the vintage comedy, starring John Inman.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest investigates when the new wife of Sir Raleigh is found dead in a locked room after seeing an Egyptian mummy. Crime drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: The island is rocked when Saint Marie's governor Caroline Bamber drops dead at her leaving party, with the commissioner standing right next to her. As DI Goodman and the team try to deduce how she could have been poisoned without their boss noticing any foul play, they find themselves entering the murky world of island politics, where blackmail, threats and corruption seem commonplace - fuelled by ongoing tension between the French and British. Meanwhile, Humphrey braves the world of online dating, under the guidance of ladies' man Dwayne - and soon finds his perfect match. Lucy Cohu and Nigel Lindsay guest star.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: The murder of Amir Aziz, a prominent anti-fundamentalist Muslim, drags the Lyell team into the murky world of hate-crime and counter-terrorism. Initially thought to be the work of a EDL member whose son was killed by the Taliban, the team begin to suspect the killing is connected to Sarah Begovic, a young woman who left the UK to relocate to Syria, but who recently returned home in secret with her six-month-old son. Feature-length episode of the crime drama, starring Richard Lintern.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: King Henry VII sets out to establish himself as the new sovereign, but finds a dangerous, deeply divided kingdom. Lizzie's loyalties are further complicated by the child she is expecting. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Hugh and Penny desperately seek a kidney donor to save Jim's life, Charlie is pursued by an obsessive fan, while Matt and Ajax track down a thief with eyes on their farm.

programme.desc: Transatlantic rivalry breaks out when the officers have to share a barracks with a platoon of American soldiers. Starring Jerome Flynn and Gary Love.

Connie passes off Zubin's plans for the future of the hospital as her own ideas and Donna confesses that she's been sleeping in the relatives' room.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Terry tracks down the paedophile who abused him as a child and, enraged by the old man's lack of remorse, resorts to physical violence. Yvonne tries to stop pregnant teenager Shirley selling her baby, but her well-meaning intervention has unexpected and potentially tragic consequences. Debbie learns her nanny has been hiding a shocking secret and Phil consoles Samantha, who is now convinced her missing daughter Abi has been abducted.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Frank's looking for a babysitter, Grant's hiding something inedible in the fridge and Ian wants to inject some drama into the season.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Grant's Boxing Day surprise doesn't have quite the effect he'd planned. Sharon hears Grant has arranged their wedding for today and is furious. Michelle is fed up with Vicki's doll.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Cynthia is concerned during a visit as she feels new mum Pamela is overly anxious, so Dr Turner arranges for a psychiatrist to come in. However, they soon discover both mother and baby have gone missing. Meanwhile, Jenny, on secondment, begins to see cracks in the establishment, Chummy discovers her mother has walked out on her father, and Trixie struggles to hide her disappointment when Tom cancels a date. Guest starring Sophie Rundle (The Bletchley Circle).

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Jenny is assigned to first-time mother Jeanette, who requires frequent visits during a protracted labour, and when she meets her patient's cousin, Philip, a new friendship begins to grow for the midwife. Meanwhile, Chummy worries about her mother's illness when she discovers Lady Browne has discharged herself from hospital. Jessica Raine and Miranda Hart star.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives of Nonnatus House return, with new nurse Barbara, who is anxious to prove herself - only to get off on the wrong foot after a late-night drinks party. A family of severely neglected children is discovered, so Trixie strives to restore their health and bring happiness into their lives, leaving Tom filled with admiration for the woman he loves, while Sister Evangelina finally undergoes tests for her abdominal pains. Shelagh finds she is at the surgery almost as much as she is at home, so the Turners come up with a solution which, for 1960, proves somewhat ground-breaking.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Barbara faces her most challenging case so far when she treats a first-time mother, only for the birth not to go according to plan. A new nurse arrives and soon makes an impression on Sister Evangelina, while Sister Julienne is worried about the increasing financial pressure on Nonnatus House, but doesn't bank on a mystery benefactor coming to the rescue. Jenny Agutter and Pam Ferris star, with Linda Bassett (East Is East) joining the cast.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean is looking forward to the pitter-patter of tiny feet - despite the fact that daughter Judith is not even pregnant.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The circus brings death to Kembleford when a clown is murdered, and Father Brown hunts the killer while trying to determine why a parishioner has agreed to marry the sinister wizard Welkin. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams as a Roman Catholic priest who attempts to solve various misdemeanours.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A fashion show takes a chilling turn when young model Zoe Mackay is strangled just moments after leaving the catwalk, and while the crew and other models come under suspicion, they all have watertight alibis. To make matters worse, there are no witnesses or DNA evidence, the only clue being a single stocking clasped in the victim's hand. What does it mean - and how was her killer able to strike without being spotted? Meanwhile, Florence tries to help Humphrey improve his social skills with the opposite sex, and JP recognises one of the models as a school crush on at school. But will she remember him?.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: An ex-convict is found murdered in his home and suspicion immediately lands on a recently released child killer. Nikki and the Lyell team are introduced to forensic psychologist Sasha Blackburn, who works closely with those released from prison on licence, as both the victim and one of the suspects are clients of hers. The investigators soon learn that it is not just the minds of these young men that are fragile, but their freedom is too. Feature-length episode of the crime drama, guest starring Lyndsey Marshal and Niamh Cusack.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Elizabeth struggles through her labour, while King Henry's envoys embark on a diplomatic mission to Burgundy, a York stronghold abroad. Negotiations are jeopardised by a twist of fate, and Lizzie learns she has more in common with her husband than she first imagined. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Penny is heartbroken when Hugh makes a series of disastrous choices about his marriage and career, while love is in the air on Hayley and Ajax's wedding day.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Dr Hugh Knight's plans to leave Whyhope are scuppered when tragedy strikes, and Penny makes a fateful decision about her love life.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: The sisters face up to the realities of life with their husbands in prison, and try to explain things to Tracey's son, Garth. Classic comedy, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: A football match is cut short when trouble arises. Elsewhere, Nelson has problems with his girlfriend, and Paddy faces a few home truths.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The day of Major Kieran Voce and Captain Kate Butler's wedding arrives. Meanwhile, Donna Tucker starts to get closer to her tutor.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Zubin arranges for Ric to be reunited with his estranged son, a situation that becomes complicated when it transpires his girlfriend is six months pregnant and hooked on drugs. When she goes into premature labour, it falls to Jess and Zubin to save the baby. Connie leaves Will to handle an emergency heart operation on his own, but Mickie comes to the rescue, displaying surprising surgical skills. Former EastEnders actress Lucy Speed guest stars as a patient expecting quads.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Terry tracks down the paedophile who abused him as a child and, enraged by the old man's lack of remorse, resorts to physical violence. Yvonne tries to stop pregnant teenager Shirley selling her baby, but her well-meaning intervention has unexpected and potentially tragic consequences. Debbie learns her nanny has been hiding a shocking secret and Phil consoles Samantha, who is now convinced her missing daughter Abi has been abducted.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Ramani fears Terry has taken the law into his own hands when both he and Malcolm Willard go missing, but it seems the aged paedophile has more to fear from Terry's brother Ben, who is also looking for revenge. Irene Radford issues dire threats after her son Wayne is found dead in his cell, apparently from an overdose, while Neil reprimands Andrea for breaking regulations - only to end up in a passionate embrace with her.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pauline and Arthur are still reeling from Mark's revelation, while Michelle and Clyde decide to tackle some unfinished business between them.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Mark is determined that Michelle shouldn't be let into the family secret, but Pauline has other ideas.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Poplar is gripped by an outbreak of dysentery, but that's the least of mum-to-be Marie Amos's worries when her husband Tony is arrested for gross indecency in the gentlemen's toilets and faces a criminal hearing. Nurse Crane meets Dolores McEvoy, a pregnant Irish woman who is clearly malnourished - but when she visits the woman's home, it turns out she has given a false address and has disappeared. Trixie is delighted when Tom asks her to oversee her first official church duty since their engagement, while at Nonnatus House, Fred tackles a rat infestation - only for Sister Monica Joan to work against him. With guest appearances by Cara Theobold (Downton Abbey) and Richard Fleeshman (Coronation Street).

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Winifred's eyes are opened to Poplar's seedy underworld when she cares for expectant prostitute Bridget Cole. Horrified by the young woman's lack of awareness, she draws on her teaching experience, and with help from Sgt Noakes sets out to promote safe sex to all local working girls. Barbara struggles to understand why expectant father Frank Robbins would pressure his wife to bear him a son, while Sister Monica Joan is feeling sidelined - until she finds herself unexpectedly assisting Shelagh with an emergency birth. Trixie invites herself along to a meeting between Tom and the Bishop - but things get tense when the idea of the couple moving to Newcastle is raised.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: A Christian Scientist couple refuse medicine for their newborn baby, leaving Sister Julienne questioning the nature of absolute faith. However, the case becomes more complicated when the parents are accused of harming their child. Barbara uses her initiative to communicate with a pregnant Sylheti woman who cannot speak English, although using the patient's young son to translate provides new problems. Sister Mary Cynthia returns to Nonnatus House and a woman catches handyman Fred's eye.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: A diabetic teenager faces a tough time after falling pregnant, a situation complicated by her boyfriend's criminal past. Nurse Crane offers what support she can - but the girl's life is endangered when the young lovers go on the run. A case of petty theft brings a group of Irish travellers to the attention of the midwives, who end up treating a newborn infant and looking after an expectant mother, and it seems Fred's romance is on the up when he asks Violet to accompany him to a fundraising dance.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean and Lionel are eager for Sandy and Harry's return from Canada.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.sub-title: The Sign of the Broken Sword
programme.desc: A murder is committed at the local army barracks using a legendary broken sword, and the incident leads the priest to investigate another death at Dunkirk 13 years previously. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Dwayne attends the funeral of local barber Cedrik Verga and shortly after is puzzled to receive a message from beyond the grave - a text from the deceased claiming 'I was murdered'. Given that his phone was in the coffin, is this a sick prank or something altogether more sinister? Humphrey agrees to investigate, and they soon find evidence to rule out his death from natural causes. Meanwhile, Humphrey demonstrates his culinary skills to Florence and the rest of the team.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: The accidental fatal shooting of a Polish teenager in an armed police operation sparks a series of murders, which links Turkish gangsters, a grieving family and a fractured firearms unit. As the inquest delivers a lawful killings verdict, IPCC investigator Vicky Sharpe calls on the Lyell team to investigate the connection between the events and review the police evidence, but Sharpe's relationship with the family of the teenager and her suspicion of the firearms division lead Nikki and Thomas to distrust her motives. Feature-length episode, starring Emilia Fox.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: The York princesses are strategically married off to strengthen the Tudor cause, but further political challenges are on the horizon. When King Henry finds himself back on the battlefield to protect his reign, Lizzie learns that the threats they face may be closer to home. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Hugh faces chaos at home and work, with a mutiny on the farm following a drunken evening and a deadly pregnancy crisis with Hayley.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: The opening of Hugh's new cardiac clinic is upset by life-changing news from his ex-wife, and Charlie's life is thrown into disarray when her father makes a visit.

programme.title: Bancroft
programme.desc: Detective Superintendent Elizabeth Bancroft is running an operation to against a vicious gang and adopts dubious methods to bring down the brothers who run it. Meanwhile, DS Katherine Stevens is assigned to a cold murder case and finds that there's more to it than it seems - and that Bancroft has some secrets in her past that may prove difficult to hide. Thriller, starring Sarah Parish, with Faye Marsay, Art Malik and Amara Khan.
