programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and the team visit Llandudno, where James Layte seriously undervalues some cutlery, and a Chinese wall plaque sells for a huge profit at auction.

programme.title: The Switch
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Sanjeev Bhaskar in which players four contestants can accumulate big cash totals by answering questions in a series of rounds that alternate between easy and hard, before one gets to the final stage and the chance to double the prize pot.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Cash Trapped
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Bradley Walsh in which six contestants battle it out across a series of fast-paced question rounds where the players must actively try to sabotage their opponents by beating them to the buzzer and trapping them out of the game. In the final round, the person who has earned the most cash will go head to head against the rest of the group to try to take their winnings home.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Charity has a plan to rile Cain, Liv worries about Aaron, while Jamie and Andrea resolve their conflict.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Roy makes an error of judgement by leaving Richard unattended, and Michelle receives a mystery offer for the Bistro. Elsewhere, Ryan begs Gary for work to pay off his debt.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: In the final episode of the series, the comedian meets a Pyrenean mountain dog that has a problem with its bladder. Elsewhere, a dog suffering from skin problems needs surgery on its eyes, and Paul also helps a West Highland white terrier that is almost twice the weight it should be get into shape.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Nina lays the blame on Roy, and Michael waits in vain for a visit from Grace and Tianna. Elsewhere, Ryan completes a mission for Gary.

programme.title: Sticks and Stones
programme.desc: In the final episode, Thomas finally opens up to his boss Chris Carter about the bullying he has been subjected to. Carter is sceptical, but Thomas insists on the issue being dealt with that day. Later, the cause of the team's behaviour is laid bare. Starring Ken Nwosu, Susannah Fielding and Ben Miller.

programme.title: Peston
programme.desc: Political magazine show presented by Robert Peston, featuring major interviews with members of Westminster, topical guests and cultural figures. With updates from social media taking in perspectives from viewers, experts and key-players throughout the programme.

programme.desc: Katherine and Joe's relationship progresses, while events take a grisly turn for the Kamara family - forcing Bancroft to offer Daanish a deal. programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Kim's actions leave everyone shocked, Liv is in peril, and Tracy's apology backfires.

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: The chef leaves Verona on one of Italy's super-fast trains and heads to Lake Garda, the biggest of the Italian lakes. Here he meets a team of rowers training for their annual regatta. After trying his hand at rowing, Gino cooks up a hearty sausage and bean casserole, before jumping on the train and heading to the city of Bolzano. There he creates a deconstructed apple crumble.

programme.title: The Big Quiz
programme.sub-title: The Big Soap Quiz: Coronation Street v Emmerdale
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the annual clash between ITV's biggest soaps, with team captains Jack P Shepherd (David Platt) and Mark Charnock (Marlon Dingle) returning to lead colleagues from Coronation Street and Emmerdale in a battle to find out who knows their soap best. Lining up from the cobbles are Sue Nicholls (Audrey Roberts), Alan Halsall (Tyrone Dobbs) and Alexandra Mardell (Emma Brooker), while making their way from the Dales are Lisa Riley (Mandy Dingle), Isabel Hodgins (Victoria Sugden) and Nick Miles (Jimmy King).

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's headlines from a Scottish perspective, plus local news from Aberdeen, Edinburgh and Glasgow.

programme.title: Bancroft
programme.desc: Detective Superintendent Bancroft is faced with a blast from the past that brings events from 1990 to the surface, and Katherine wrestles with new information that she is uncovering. Elsewhere, Daanish fulfils his part of the deal, and Anya makes a surprising visits to an old friend. Starring Sarah Parish, Faye Marsay and Amara Karan.

programme.title: Stephen Fry in Central America
programme.desc: Stephen's travels continue in Costa Rica, where he encounters poison-dart frogs and falls in love with a baby sloth at a biological research station. But he soon finds there is more to the country than conservation and eco-tourism as he ascends volcanoes, descends white-water rivers and experiences the passion of a football derby in the capital of San Jose. He then crosses over into Panama for the final leg of his trip, witnessing giant leatherback turtles coming ashore to lay their eggs and learning how to dredge the canal in Panama City.

Tony blows someone else's trumpet, James gets danced out of his dosh, Alison drops thousands on a claret jug, while Corrie gets her hand on a sparkling solitaire ring.

programme.desc: Host Sanjeev Bhaskar invites four new contestants to accumulate big cash totals by answering super quick-fire easy money questions. However, in order to take home that cash, they must survive The Switch, a series of three super hard multiple-choice questions that each has only one incorrect choice.

programme.desc: Tracy opens up to Vanessa, Aaron looks for a distraction, and Sam gets an idea.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Robert's court hearing is delayed when new information comes to light, and Gary gets wind of Derek's plot to sell the factory. Meanwhile, Roy attempts to make peace with Nina.

programme.title: Hayman's Way
programme.desc: The best of David Hayman's travels across Scotland, featuring spectacular scenery, fascinating facts, rich mythology and some extraordinary characters.

programme.title: Coronation Street at Christmas
programme.desc: A look at the rich seam of Weatherfield's archive to showcase the stories that have entertained millions over the festive season for almost six decades - from weddings and babies to flings and fights, not forgetting those Christmas dinner-disasters and poignant goodbyes. Contributors including Barbara Knox, Chris Gascoyne, Jane Danson, William Roache, Sue Nicholls, Simon Gregson, Jack P Shepherd, Helen Flanagan, Thelma Barlow and Julie Goodyear share their memories of watching numerous, big Christmas storylines. Narrated by Sue Johnston.

programme.title: Ball & Boe: A Very Merry Christmas
programme.desc: After the huge success of their previous albums and sold-out tours, Michael Ball and Alfie Boe reunite for a festive night of music. Showcasing both their unique blend of extraordinary talent and infectious humour, the duo perform exciting new material alongside some Christmas favourites, as well as singing with special guests Shirley Bassey, Luke Evans and Gregory Porter.

programme.title: Bancroft
programme.desc: Katherine and Anya make a determined push to get to the bottom of the Laura Fraser case once and for all, hatching a plan to get the DNA evidence they desperately need. Bancroft executes a massive sting operation against Athif Kamara, but things do not run smoothly and she is forced to reveal carefully kept secrets about her past. Thriller, starring Sarah Parish, Faye Marsay and Amara Khan.

programme.title: Bang on the Money
programme.desc: Rickie Haywood-Williams and Melvin Odoom host the game show in which two teams of friends must battle it out to hit a specific target number 'bang on' in a series of physical and mental challenges. At the end of the contest, the most successful group could win up to 40,000. This week's teams are the Suits in the City from London and Team Samanda from the Wirral.

programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.desc: Kayo and John must stop the Chaos Crew from stealing a dangerous chemical from a global seed vault.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny's challenge will see him attempt to escape from a helicopter simulator underwater. Has he got what it takes to be submerged?.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Chaotic cartoon capers following the further adventures of the popular halfwit immortalised in the live-action TV series and Hollywood film. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The popular halfwit tries to be romantic, but his idea of what that means proves to be very different to Irma's. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Monsters and ghouls get in the way of the Scooby gang's adventures as they travel and spend time together in the summer.

programme.title: The Sara Cox Show
programme.sub-title: The Sara Cox Show at Christmas
programme.desc: Sara is joined by Emmerdale's Isabel Hodgins and Susan Cookson, actor Steve Pemberton and comedian Jayde Adams. There is also live music from Beverley Knight.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.sub-title: James Martin's Saturday Morning at Christmas
programme.desc: The chef is back in the kitchen with festive food and guests including radio DJ Chris Evans, Gavin & Stacey star Joanna Page and Viscountess Emma Weymouth.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner reveal their take on classic festive dishes, including the perfect turkey, roast potatoes, and a classic Christmas cake.

programme.title: Nadia's Family Feasts
programme.desc: Nadia Sawalha creates an American-themed meal with Christian Stevenson - aka DJ BBQ. On the menu are Maryland home fries for breakfast, buttermilk fried chicken for lunch, Christian's Smash Burger and tomato pie for dinner, with Nadia's Washington apple crisp for dessert.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: While investigating the shooting of a council clerk, Barnaby and Jones discover he was an expert blackmailer. A phone number on the dead man's blotter sends the duo to the seaside in search of his latest targets - whose boat trip could conceal a motive for the killing. Meanwhile, Joyce is convinced a local farmer knows more than he is telling. Julia McKenzie and Grant Masters guest star, with John Nettles and Jason Hughes.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: In the final episode of the series, the comedian meets a Pyrenean mountain dog that has a problem with its bladder. Elsewhere, a dog suffering from skin problems needs surgery on its eyes, and Paul also helps a West Highland white terrier that is almost twice the weight it should be get into shape.

programme.title: Shrek (2001)
programme.desc: Anti-social ogre Shrek resolves to stop an evil ruler from banishing fairy-tale characters to his swampland home. However, the reluctant hero ends up forced to rescue the beautiful Princess Fiona from a castle guarded by a dragon, aided only by a wisecracking donkey. Animated comedy, with the voices of Mike Myers, John Lithgow, Cameron Diaz, Eddie Murphy and Vincent Cassel.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents a festive episode in which the Rev Kate Bottley, Dr Ranj Singh, Made in Chelsea's Georgia 'Toff' Toffolo and comedian Ed Byrne pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a festive special of the game show from Manchester, where he sets members of the public unusual Christmas-themed challenges and unwraps a variety of hilarious games.

programme.title: Casino Royale (2006)
programme.desc: James Bond achieves his '00' status and is dispatched on the trail of Le Chiffre, an international criminal financing terrorist organisations around the world. Bond's investigation leads to a casino in Montenegro, where he takes part in a high-stakes poker game in a bid to bankrupt Le Chiffre and put an end to his plans. Spy thriller, directed by Martin Campbell and starring Daniel Craig in his first outing as 007, with Eva Green, Mads Mikkelsen, Judi Dench and Giancarlo Giannini.

credits.actor: Daniel Craig in his first outing as 007

programme.title: Basic Instinct (1992)
programme.desc: A hard-drinking San Francisco cop investigates the case of a man murdered with an ice-pick, but his normally well-honed intuition starts letting him down as he falls for the sultry and manipulative chief suspect, the victim's former girlfriend. Thriller from director Paul Verhoeven, starring Sharon Stone, Michael Douglas, George Dzundza and Jeanne Tripplehorn.

programme.title: Who's Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Actress, comedian and writer Helen Lederer throws today's dinner party, and Brian McFadden provides another four diners with cryptic clues hinting at the identity of their mystery hostess.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: How to Spend It Well at Christmas with Phillip Schofield
programme.desc: The This Morning presenter returns to put more Christmas gifts to the test, aided by his wife Steph, celebrity guests and members of the public. They begin by gearing up for Black Friday with tips on the best gifts and gadgets on the market. With sales of personal electric vehicles on the up, Corrie trio Jack P Shepherd (David), Alan Halsall (Tyrone) and Colson Smith (Craig) put hoverboards and scooters to the test. Clare Balding is on a mission to find the perfect present for pets and Eddie 'the Eagle' Edwards ranks gift experiences such as track racing, skydiving and flyboarding.

programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: A martian scientist gets lost in an underground cave, leading Virgil, Alan and Captain Taylor to assist.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny's in Blackpool but is he brave enough to walk to the top of the UK's tallest rollercoaster?.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz beams himself into Weasel's brain in order to take out Magoo with tranquilliser darts. Magoo loses Mr Cat and enlists his neighbour to find him..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks he's in a triathlon and takes Fizz's superhuman strength headband, which Fizz needs to beat the President at a thumb war.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Today's the big day, and Magoo believes he is in a recording studio to make a hit single for famous producer, Phil Dustspeck. But is that really true?.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The popular halfwit enters a competition to win a trolley of free food. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Chaotic cartoon capers following the further adventures of the popular halfwit immortalised in the live-action TV series and Hollywood film. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: The Sara Cox Show
programme.sub-title: The Sara Cox Show at Christmas
programme.desc: Sara is joined by author Marian Keyes and sports pundit Chris Kamara, and there is live music from Will Young. Plus, some last-minute gift ideas for under 20 and a Christmas breakfast feast from Georgina Hayden.

programme.title: Beautiful Baking with Juliet Sear
programme.desc: Juliet conjures up some ideas for Christmas, including baked party canapes, a brussels sprouts tarte tatin and a spectacular chocolate orange profiteroles tower. Liam Charles pays a visit to serve up Christmas lunch on a sheet of ruff puff pastry and Juliet visits chef Chantelle Nicholson in her London restaurant to sample a vegan main course Christmas meal.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John and Lisa cook up some family festive favourites, including glazed ham, a baked Tunworth cheese with onions and potatoes, and mini turkey and ham pies. Plus, Lisa decorates the tree with some beautiful Christmas biscuits.

programme.title: Nadia's Family Feasts
programme.desc: Nadia Sawalha and Alex Hollywood help to prepare a festive family feast, including Nadia's annual tradition of hot sausage and cheddar rolls for breakfast, ginger gammon with tartiflette for lunch, a recipe for the ultimate turkey dinner, and Alex's delicious alternative to dessert with a white chocolate, raspberry and cranberry brioche for pudding.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Scott investigate when a man collapses and dies outside a pub after a fight with his brother-in-law. The discovery of suspicious burn marks on the victim's forehead reveals sinister secrets and when a second body is found, the detectives are drawn into a world of superstition and family tensions. Murder mystery with John Nettles, John Hopkins and guest starring Geoffrey Whitehead.

programme.title: How to Spend It Well at Christmas with Phillip Schofield
programme.desc: The presenter takes a look at the best Christmas deals on food and drink. The stars of The Real Housewives of Cheshire take a blind taste test to see if they can tell the difference between supermarket sparkling wine and real champagne. Mother and daughter Janet Ellis and Sophie Ellis-Bextor get to grips with some 1970s-style retro kitchen appliances, and Matt Tebbutt samples Phillip's efforts with a DIY home gin-making kit.

programme.title: The Big Quiz
programme.sub-title: The Big Soap Quiz: Coronation Street v Emmerdale
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the annual clash between ITV's biggest soaps, with team captains Jack P Shepherd (David Platt) and Mark Charnock (Marlon Dingle) returning to lead colleagues from Coronation Street and Emmerdale in a battle to find out who knows their soap best. Lining up from the cobbles are Sue Nicholls (Audrey Roberts), Alan Halsall (Tyrone Dobbs) and Alexandra Mardell (Emma Brooker), while making their way from the Dales are Lisa Riley (Mandy Dingle), Isabel Hodgins (Victoria Sugden) and Nick Miles (Jimmy King).

programme.title: The Pride of Britain Awards
programme.desc: Carol Vorderman, who is synonymous with the uplifting annual event, hits the road to visit some of the ceremony's winners over its two-decade history. In Torbay, she catches up with winners of the Emergency Services award - six of the seven crew of the RNLI who risked their lives to save eight stranded seamen. Carol walks the walk with fundraiser of the year 2008 Nina Barough and does a milk round with crime-fighting milkman and now MBE Tony Fowler. She also meets Rachel Edwards, who aged seven collected a Child of Courage award in 2001.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a Christmas Celebrity Special of the game show, with Davina McCall, Jarvis Cocker and Jo Brand hoping to win the50,000 jackpot for their chosen charity. That's if they can guess what Mr Chips is doing.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby present the launch show for the 12th series of the skating challenge. The famous faces taking part this year are magician Ben Hanlin, reality TV star Maura Higgins, Diversity member Perri Kiely, model and businesswoman Caprice, TV presenter Trisha Goddard, actress Lisa George, Paralympian Libby Clegg, ex-EastEnder Joe Swash, Steps singer Ian 'H' Watkins, newsreader Lucrezia Millarini, former footballer Kevin Kilbane, and TV personality Michael Barrymore. In this first edition, the celebrities are paired up with their professional partners, while Torvill and Dean also perform a spectacular routine with some special guests, before taking to the judges' desk alongside Ashley Banjo and newcomer John Barrowman.

programme.title: Quantum of Solace (2008)
programme.desc: James Bond sets out on a personal mission of vengeance as he pursues the secret criminal organisation Quantum. His search leads him to the head of an ecological corporation, who is plotting to orchestrate a coup in a Latin American country to get his hands on a precious natural resource. Spy thriller sequel, starring Daniel Craig, Olga Kurylenko, Judi Dench, Gemma Arterton and Mathieu Amalric.

programme.title: Ball & Boe: A Very Merry Christmas
programme.desc: After the huge success of their previous albums and sold-out tours, Michael Ball and Alfie Boe reunite for a festive night of music. Showcasing both their unique blend of extraordinary talent and infectious humour, the duo perform exciting new material alongside some Christmas favourites, as well as singing with special guests Shirley Bassey, Luke Evans and Gregory Porter.

programme.title: Meet the Parents
programme.desc: Dating show, hosted by Holly Willoughby, which puts the love lives of singletons in the hands of the people they know best - their mum and dad. Each week, one man and one woman must choose from three potential partners, with their decisions solely based on an encounter with the contestants' parents.

programme.title: What Would Be Your Miracle?
programme.desc: Emma Willis presents the stories of people whose lives are being transformed by modern medicine, and follows them as they make their wildest dreams come true. In the opening episode, Emma meets Adele and Ashley from Aberdare, Wales, who are desperate to see their son Garin, who has cerebral palsy, walk for the first time. Now, thanks to surgery in America, there's every chance their dream could come true. And if it does, Garin has one further dream - to play football. Plus, the story of Lancashire woman Andrea, who has been deaf since childhood but is now also going blind. Will a cochlear implant allow her to hear for the first time in decades?.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: How to Spend It Well at Christmas with Phillip Schofield
programme.desc: The presenter introduces a guide to this year's must-have toys, and Leicester City striker Jamie Vardy and his wife Rebekah join five families in trying out the latest board games. Phillip competes against racing driver Billy Monger in a remote control car road test, Stacey Solomon checks out fancy dress costumes for children, and children recommend presents under 15.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Scott investigate the apparent suicide of a solicitor rumoured to have been stealing money from clients. When rival lawyer Otto Benham is later found murdered in a bizarre manner, the detectives begin to suspect the two deaths may be related. Mystery, starring John Nettles, John Hopkins, Barry Jackson, James Weber Brown and Oliver Ford Davies.

programme.title: The Mummy Returns (2001)
programme.desc: Married explorers Rick and Evelyn battle the newly resurrected mummy Imhotep and his ruthless partner, who have captured their son. The undead creature is heading for a confrontation with a legendary ancient warrior - with power over a magical army to be won. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Brendan Fraser, Rachel Weisz, John Hannah, Arnold Vosloo, Oded Fehr and Patricia Velasquez, with a brief appearance by Dwayne Johnson.

credits.actor: a brief appearance by Dwayne Johnson

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: The Santa Clause (1994)
programme.desc: A grumpy divorced father faces a dilemma one Christmas Eve after accidentally startling Santa and causing him to fall to his death. The guilty man's only option is to put on the red suit, jump into the sleigh and finish the round himself, much to his son's delight. Fantasy comedy, starring Tim Allen, Judge Reinhold, Wendy Crewson, Eric Lloyd and David Krumholtz.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show, asking three contestants to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win 50,000

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Anton Du Beke, Alistair McGowan, Sarah-Jane Crawford and Adrian Edmondson pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: As the locals prepare for Christmas Day, Leyla's hopes are raised, Rhona feels guilty about leaving, and Kim has a proposal for Marlon.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Nick and Sarah unveil the refurbished factory to the staff, keeping quiet about Derek's change of heart, while Sean reveals to an appalled Fiz that Jade is living on the streets. Rita tells Gemma she has arranged to visit Mavis over Christmas, despite the fact she has no plans to go anywhere. Emma and Seb become a couple, but will Alina ruin their romance?.

programme.title: Countrywise
programme.desc: Liz Bonnin finds out about the festive ingredients to be found in Cheshire's Delamere Forest, and Ben Fogle is at Castle Howard in North Yorkshire - one of the grand settings of ITV's Victoria - to help with the renovation of its gold dome. There is also one last visit to Yorkshire Dales shepherdess Amanda Owen as the farm prepares for winter and her children get ready for Christmas.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Gary lies to Maria that Derek ran into financial trouble, so he swooped in to save the factory and the workers' jobs. Later, he locks a tied-up Derek in the furniture shop overnight, determined to make sure he misses his flight to Florida with his kids. Fiz and Tyrone find Jade on Victoria Street and drag her back to No 9 and, while Rita decorates her tree alone, Emma informs Seb that Alina came looking for him.

programme.title: Gordon, Gino and Fred: Road Trip
programme.sub-title: Gordon, Gino and Fred: Christmas Road Trip - Three Unwise Men
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay, Gino D'Acampo and Fred Sirieix reconvene after their European travels to rediscover the spirit of Christmas, heading to the unlikely festive destination of Morocco to see what the North African country has to offer in the way of culture, cuisine and adventure. The trio journey through the Agafay desert by camel, on through the mountains and end up deep in Marrakesh's marketplace and souks, with their trip culminating in a festive feast inspired by their travels, the people they have met and the experiences they have had.

programme.title: Gremlins (1984)
programme.desc: A teenager is given a strange, cute creature as a Christmas present by his eccentric father and warned to keep it away from water, not to feed it after midnight, or expose it to direct light. However, a chance dousing causes the furball to spawn a horde of murderous little monsters, and their devilish antics bring mayhem to a small town. Comedy horror, with Zach Galligan, Phoebe Cates, Hoyt Axton and Polly Holliday.

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.sub-title: Killer from the Abyss - Part One
programme.desc: Jeremy Wade takes on the biggest investigation of his career - to unravel what happened to the passengers of the RMS Laconia, torpedoed in the mid-Atlantic.

programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The naked body of a business executive is found dumped in a rival factory's steriliser machine, leaving Barnaby and Scott with a complicated mystery to unravel. Their investigation begins with factory owners the Plummers, who seem to be hiding more than their share of secrets. Detective drama, starring John Nettles, John Hopkins, Annette Crosbie and Jasper Britton.

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill opens his diary to look at a typical year in the life of a You've Been Framed! star, taking in all the major events in the calendar, from Pancake Day disasters to horrific Halloweens.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: How The Grinch Stole Christmas (2000)
programme.desc: A little girl residing in the Christmas-obsessed town of Whoville becomes fascinated with a grouchy creature living in the mountains. But her efforts to make him part of their celebrations leave him more bitter than ever, and he resolves to ruin the festive season. Fantasy comedy, based on Dr Seuss's children's book, with Jim Carrey, Taylor Momsen, Jeffrey Tambor and Molly Shannon. Anthony Hopkins narrates.

programme.title: Santa Claus: The Movie (1985)
programme.desc: An impulsive elf walks out on Father Christmas during the hectic preparations for the festive season, and heads for New York determined to make a name for himself. However, he falls into the clutches of an evil toy manufacturer, who has a devilish money-making plan up his sleeve. Family fantasy adventure, starring Dudley Moore, John Lithgow, David Huddleston, Burgess Meredith and Judy Cornwell.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Elf (2003)
programme.desc: A child is taken in by kind-hearted Santa and raised as an elf - so it comes as a shock when he discovers years later that he is in fact human. Deciding to get back to his roots, he heads off for New York in search of his long-lost family, but is ill-prepared for the hustle and bustle of the Big Apple. Fantasy comedy, starring Will Ferrell, James Caan, Zooey Deschanel and Edward Asner.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: While Graham receives some important results, Kim's blood runs cold and Nate feels isolated.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: One of the most enjoyable things for viewers of The Chase is watching Bradley Walsh collapse in a fit of giggles after pronouncing a question wrong, or when a rude-sounding name crops up - or taking a contestant to one side to give them a telling-off if they get too big for their boots. Here, the host presents a third selection of these and other such unscripted moments and out-takes from the teatime quiz show.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Gary frees Derek from his bonds, and Fiz calls at the furniture shop to drop off items from a house clearance, including a live antique gun. In the Rovers, a drunk Ali vows to win back Maria and see Gary get his comeuppance. Elsewhere, Marion rails at Shona and David for banning Max from seeing her.

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show
programme.desc: The host welcomes another batch of celebrity guests to his famous green room for a special Christmas edition of the talk show. He is joined by David Tennant, whose demonic role in Terry Pratchett and Neil Gaiman's Good Omens will be coming to BBC in the new year, as well as singers Rita Ora and Jamie Cullum, former X Factor judge Sharon Osbourne, Strictly Come Dancing: It Takes Two presenter Rylan Clark-Neal, award-winning Hollywood star David Oyelowo and comedian Bec Hill.

programme.title: Not the Robbie Williams Christmas Show
programme.desc: In a one-off special recorded at London's Alexandra Palace Theatre, the singer performs classic hits, plus new Christmas songs. He's also joined by guests including David Walliams and Jamie Cullum.

programme.title: The Keith & Paddy Picture Show
programme.desc: A festive special in which Keith Lemon and Paddy McGuinness team up to remake Joe Dante's 1984 horror comedy Gremlins. Original star Zach Galligan helps out as they tackle the story of a cute little creature given as a Christmas present, but which spawns a horde of murderous little monsters after an accidental dowsing with water, with appearances by Kara Tointon, John Thomson, Su Pollard, Les Dennis and Arthur Bostrom..

programme.title: Carols at Christmas 2019
programme.desc: Myleene Klass leads the congregation of St Elisabeth's Church, Stockport in a traditional Christmas Eve carol service. The celebrations include festive performances from singer-songwriter KT Tunstall, musical theatre group Collabro, big-band crooner Mark Kingswood and West End star Marisha Wallace.

programme.title: Casino Royale (1967)
programme.desc: Ageing spy James Bond comes out of retirement to tackle a mysterious mastermind who wants to take over the world. Meanwhile, another agent disguises himself as Bond to face the evil genius over the baccarat table. Spoof spy adventure, starring David Niven, Peter Sellers, Woody Allen, Orson Welles, Deborah Kerr and Ursula Andress.
